"Phantom"

"Phantom is a Successor Class that combines strong evasive abilities with a wide variety of attacks.

Phantoms are able to equip Rods, Katanas and Rifles. However, they use them in vastly different ways from how they work in the hands of any other class.

Rod
Combo attacks with PAs and Techniques.
Katana
High maneuverability, high power.
Rifles
Attacks that employ the assistance of \"Bits\"."

"To change to the Phantom class, you must first complete a specific Client Order.

To complete this Client Order, you will need to earn a Title whose conditions are getting 2 or more classes to Lv. 75 or higher."

"Phantom is different from other classes in a number of ways:

・Cannot set a subclass
(If a Quest has level restrictions that refer to your subclass, only consider the level of your main class.)

・Some potentials and Skill Rings have no effect
(E.g. Battle Awakening, R/Attack Advance, etc.)

・Has its own set of level cap release orders
・Support Partners cannot have their class set to Phantom"
"Phantom Rod"

"When a Rod is equipped by a Phantom, it performs \"Phantom Rod\" attacks and PAs instead of normal Rod attacks.

Phantom Rod specializes in wide-area attacks, which it can combine with Techniques.

Some Phantom Rod PAs do different things if the button is held, and one directly interacts with Technique casting."

"Phantom Rod's Weapon Action fires a \"Photon Bullet\", which can inflict damage and recover PP at a distance.

Its charged Weapon Action is a wide-area attack, which is particularly effective against groups of enemies."

"Phantom weapons can turn their PAs into alternate \"Shift PAs\" by using them during a Weapon Action.

These attacks have different properties from normal, so choose which one to use carefully based on your situation.

※Shift PAs do not activate during charged Weapon Actions."

"Technique Attacks

If you cast a Technique while equipped with Phantom Rod, you will simultaneously perform an additional attack known as a \"Technique Attack\".

There are two types of Technique Attack, long-range and short-range, and which one you use depends on the Technique.

Technique Attacks can also recover PP when they hit.
※Some Techniques do not have a Technique Attack."
"Phantom Katana"

"When a Katana is equipped by a Phantom, it performs \"Phantom Katana\" attacks and PAs instead of normal Katana attacks.

Phantom Katana has high mobility, and many of its PAs focus on attacking a single target. If you learn to combine your PAs effectively, you will be able to move around while inflicting heavy damage."

"Phantom Katana's Weapon Action lets you perform a slash while evading, meaning you never have to stop attacking when you fight.

In addition, the charged Weapon Action is a powerful single strike, which is effective against large targets such as bosses."

"Phantom weapons can turn their PAs into alternate \"Shift PAs\" by using them during a Weapon Action.

These attacks have different properties from normal, so choose which one to use carefully based on your situation.

※Shift PAs do not activate during charged Weapon Actions."
"Phantom Rifle"

"When a Rifle is equipped by a Phantom, it performs \"Phantom Rifle\" attacks and PAs instead of normal Rifle attacks.

Phantom Rifle is a flexible weapon that can adjust the timing of its PAs by holding the button and releasing it at different times.

Some Phantom Rifle PAs use \"Bits\", which perform their own attacks on a slight delay. To maximise your effectiveness, try to coordinate your attacks with what your Bits are doing."

"Phantom Rifle's Weapon Action fires \"Bits\", which attack enemies indirectly at long range.

You can also charge the Weapon Action to shoot a powerful piercing shot."

"Phantom weapons can turn their PAs into alternate \"Shift PAs\" by using them during a Weapon Action.

These attacks have different properties from normal, so choose which one to use carefully based on your situation.

※Shift PAs do not activate during charged Weapon Actions."
"Phantom Marker"

"\"Phantom Marker\" is a Class Skill that activates automatically if it has been learned.

If you attack an enemy several times, you will place a marker on it. If you then continue to attack the marked enemy, you will increase the level of the marker.

※The visual indicator of the marker disappears over time, but the effect remains. If you attack the enemy again, the marker visual will reappear."

"Once an enemy has a marker on it, hitting the enemy with a charged Phantom Weapon Action will cause the marker to detonate.

In addition to dealing heavy damage, the detonation recovers a large amount of PP.

Incorporating Phantom Marker detonation into your combos will increase your effectiveness in battle dramatically.

※Note that the explosion will occur at the location on the enemy that your charged Weapon Action hit, which is not necessarily the same location that the marker was on."
"Phantom Time"

"When you learn the skill \"Phantom Time\", a \"Phantom Gear\" Gauge is added to all Phantom weapons, and a special action called \"Phantom Time\" becomes available. The Gear Gauge fills up as you attack enemies.

When the Gear Gauge is at 50% or higher, you can activate \"Phantom Time\" to gain the following effects:

・Invincibility for 5 seconds after activation
・Additional invincibility time during Step
・PP consumption reduced by 20%"

"Phantom Time Finish

Phantom Time Finish is a powerful finishing move, which you can perform by reactivating Phantom Time while it is still active.

When you activate Phantom Time Finish, Phantom Time ends. Think carefully about when to use it.

Phantom Time Finish will be one of three moves. Which one you use depends on which Phantom weapon you currently have equipped."
